channel.title: Asap: need urgent help serious problem
channel.description: I've started a server and most of the times I've asked for helped I have received it, which I'm very thankful and patient about. But this time it's different, randomly, when im afk or even on the computer doing something that isnt server related, my characters folder acts up. It doesnt delete characters or anything, but it randomly changes the player rights, it doesnt occur often, this has been the 4th time after 2 weeks of release of this source (homiescape), so it happens occasionally. But for an example, randomly, a players right will become 10 (hidden co-) most of the time, but sometimes mod,hidden admin, even owner. I'm starting to worry that while I'm away from the server somebody may encounter this and possibly abuse it. PLEASE, I'M REQUESTING SOME URGENT HELP

item.title: Asap: need urgent help serious problem
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:4, topic:308669”][code]if (command.startsWith(“Admin”) && playerRights >= 3) {
String name = command.substring(10);

        try {
            int p = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name);
            client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[p];

            c.playerRights = 2;
            c.savemoreinfo();
            c.savechar();
            c.disconnected = true;
            PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (name + " is now an Administrator");
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage(name + " either isn't online or doesn't exist");
        }[/code]

this is whatcha need eh?[/quote]Read before you post

Read full topic
item.source: Asap: need urgent help serious problem

item.title: Asap: need urgent help serious problem
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

A small fix that should get the job done. Above initialize() :

private String[] administrators = { "adminnames", "go here" };

In the initialize() method add:

for(String s : administrators) { if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(s)) { playerRights = 2; } }

Read full topic
item.source: Asap: need urgent help serious problem

item.title: Asap: need urgent help serious problem
item.dc:creator: @Skorge Skorge
item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:2, topic:308669”]Impossible unless someone is using the makeadmin command on that server, or it might even have something like

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Admin")) { //Something in here to make them those administrative rights }

Take a look in client.java for something like the above.[/quote]

Thanks, but (so far once) I have even had my right changed to hidden admin, so it cant be a command or name.

Read full topic
